ygData.subject: RE: [warriors_eq] Latest Patch
ygData.msgSnippet: Dont feel bad about the low str.  Like I said before my Gnome warrior does just fine.  One thing I would try and do is get a faster weapon in your main hand
ygData.messageBody:
Dont feel bad about the low str.  Like I said before my Gnome warrior does just fine.  One thing I would try and do is get a faster weapon in your main hand but that will come.  Wait till mid to high 40s and go to Karnors try and get a Jade Mace (9/18) or wait till about 51 or so and try and get a lamenation 9/19 some stats as well.  But those weapons you have are much better than what I had at your lvl when I played my rogue, the warrior had great gear from lvl 6 or so.  So enjoy your DE warrior and dont worry about the str.
 
Mu
-----Original Message-----
From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 28, 2001 6:20 PM
To: warriors_eq@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [warriors_eq] Latest Patch

 Well I am closing in on 40...thanks to the advice here.
 
I bought an icetooth claw (11/29) and a crystallized sword(11/29) for my 1hs.  I finally got 2 orc fang earrings as well. traded in my BI belt for a stawspun (10ac).
I have the treeweave for the str modifier.  I goofed early on and my base str is only 80.  I have an enamalled black BP sitting in my bank box that the treeweave replaced.  Going to hang on to it for a little while in case I decide to cash in the treeweave for other gear.  Oh, I also got a rygor mail helm...it has a str modifier and is the same AC as my old skull shaped barbute.
 
Exploring Velious now and having a blast. My poor druid twink is getting no attention...having to much fun double swinging my new toys.
 
Qapla!
 
Bael
Tier'dal Warrior of the 39th Level
-----Original Message-----
From: Kailyn Of Povar [mailto:KailynOfPovar@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 28, 2001 5:54 PM
To: warriors_eq@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Latest Patch

Unless you are having problems carrying your gear you really don't need treeweave. Get yourself a BEBP or Crafted BP and then trade that sucker. That should be good plat. At 36th I would head over to Iceclad and camp snow cougars (they still should be good XP) for the cougar claw earrings. I am thinking about getting Kailyn one. I do really like the resist, though from the 3 AC/ 8 disease resistance earrings I have. Golden topaz??
I am pretty comfortable in a group with my warrior at level 36.  I've known my role in a group all along.  I started grouping almost exclusively at around level 15, though I can still solo a bit if I pick my locations carefully. Currently I am doing soloing in Lower Guk live side if I can't get a group.   I really am trying to get in on Lord or Frenzy (Ha! good luck). My exec axe is not as effective for me as it was at 30.  Soloing it doesn't swing often enough to do the damage fast enough.  I think I am underequipped in 1hs also using a enamelled black mace and a obsidian scimitar.  Perhaps its just because it seems everyone I group with has better weapons then I do.
 
Anyone have suggestions as to what weapons I should acquire.  I was planning on a mithril 2-hander so I can keep an AC belt on instead of an FBSS. Other suggestions are welcome.
 
I am well equipped armor wise (I think), but I am cash poor.
Armor:
Treeweave
crafted arms, legs, bracers, gauntlets, boots, Black iron belt
trying to get some orc fang earrings...sold my +4 str +2 int earrings
got 2 jagged bands
skull shaped barbute
 
Advice is welcome.
 
Bael
Tier'dal Warrior 36th Level
on Bertoxxulus
 
From: Robert Wilbarg
3) Warriors were only "useless" the first 6 months of the games existence...I know I experienced it first hand (same armor, weapons & hps as everyone else with zero distinguishing skills) .  These days with decent warr specific armor & weapons we tank very well at most levels.
Oh boy do I remember those days. Before Crafted. Heck beserk did not even get added to the game before I hit 16th. Those were the days the rangers were king. I even remember having the same skill caps for O and D too. I was so dreading having to camp Rubi or buy steel armor. 500 plat is a heck of a lot for a warrior. I think I was in a bronze BP til 35th or so.
4) The idea that warriors don't contribute significant offensive damage is an old idea.  With the uber hps high level MOBs the damage we contribute over time is quite significant.
Not to mention they have completely monty hauled the weapons we use to keep all melee types significant. I wish they had fixed the combat system instead. Do you remember when the 10/21 Spined dragon Claws were one of the best weapons in the game. I can now get the as good or better Lamentation (9/19 6 str/stm 20 HP) on a much easier camp (LOL if you can camp the draco-lich). And what is the new spear from SoV? 13/20??!!
5) Raising the defensive caps for the other classes actually makes them stronger in the groups I play in.  That means my groups survive more. I kind of like that.
6) The mid 30s-40s is a tough spot for warriors.  Mostly because the other tank classes (Rangers/SKs in particular) have similar agro capability to ourselves at this point but little experience in the value of their role in a group.  By the mid 40s very few Rangers, SKs & Pallies are actively trying wrest agro away from a warrior...at least if they have any brains.

regards

Flair Shieldrender
54 Champion Fennin Ro
LOL did you ever hear about the Weekend Warrior Walkout Flair? That was something I helped with waaaaaaayyyyy back in the day.
 
Melee Questions? http://kailyn.topcities.com (yeah I know I need to update it badly).
 
Kailyn Longstride
52nd Champion, Povar
 
Dythe 32 Rogue
Prann 22 Wizard
